alert.note: Alert for Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:02AM EST until January 29 at 7:36PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in West Virginia... Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. For the Cacapon River...including Great Cacapon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cacapon River near Great Cacapon. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Rock Ford Road begins to flood in multiple locations, including flowing completely over the low water bridge. Constant Run Road and a small portion of Kilgore Road also begin to flood. At 11.0 feet, Kilgore Road is flooded in multiple spots. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 3.3 feet, or 5.7 feet below flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 10.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 04/21/1940. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Sun Sun Mon Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1PM 7PM 1AM Stg Time Date Cacapon River Great Cacapo 9.0 3.3 Sun 8 am 6.1 9.4 10.3 10.3 1am Mon &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. this evening at 915 PM EST.
